featured.text: Natives planted the fruit across South and Central America and in the Caribbean region, 23 Christopher Columbus first found it.
Whenever I set foot on the soil of Rwanda, a country in east-central Africa, I feel as if I have entered paradise: green hills, red earth, sparkling rivers and mountain lakes.
Waimea Canyon, called the "Grand Canyon of the Pacific" by Mark Twain, cuts a deep gash through the rugged central mountains.
Despite their great 28 , however, most domesticated apples can be traced back to a common ancestor, the wild apple of Central Asia, Malus sieversii.
There is currently no reason to believe that plants experience pain, because they are devoid of central nervous systems and brains.

definition.zh_def: 中心的；主要的；最重要的
definition.en_def: Located at or near the center; of primary importance.
definition.example: The central park is a great place to relax.
